channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-3946] java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.activemq.transport.tcp.TcpTransportFactory cannot be cast to org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory
item.description:
Weird behavior in org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory#findTransportFactory:178.

This cast exception Exception is thrown (depending on some configuration of deployed project) when using Fuse on EAP with external A-MQ. ActiveMQ connection factories configured in resource adapter.
In some cases the returned TcpTransportFactory (as found for tcp protocol) cannot be cast to TransportFactory. It looks like some issue with classloading.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I may have found in server log another useful info:

James Netherton Can you take a look James? If it's SwitchYard related you can pass over to Tom.

As an initial guess (and I really hope I'm wrong), the ActiveMQ RAR libraries are potentially clashing with those provided by the WildFly-Camel ActiveMQ module.

But I cannot build the testsuite mentioned above to verify because of:

Failed to execute goal on project transaction-test-parent: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.jboss.qe.fsw.transaction:transaction-test-parent:pom:1.0-SNAPSHOT: The following artifacts could not be resolved: org.jboss.qe.fsw.transaction:transaction-test-core:jar:1.0-SNAPSHOT, org.jboss.qe.fsw.transaction:transaction-test-core:jar:tests:1.0-SNAPSHOT, org.jboss.qe.fsw:shared-tools:jar:1.0-SNAPSHOT: Failure to find org.jboss.qe.fsw.transaction:transaction-test-core:jar:1.0-SNAPSHOT in http://dl.bintray.com/jboss-soa-qa/maven/ was cached in the local repository, resolution will not be reattempted until the update interval of jboss-soa-qa-maven-repository has elapsed or updates are forced -

Václav Chalupa how do I build jbossqe-fsw-it ???

I got the test suite running. I fixed it by removing the restriction on packages being exported from the org.apache.activemq module and all of the tests passed. Before I commit any changes for this, I need to understand the relationships between the AMQ resource adapter deployment, the AMQ and the AMQ Camel component EAP modules.

Here's the stack trace for the ClassCastException.

James Netherton sorry for the issues with building the reproducer, I tried it with clean maven repository and it seemed to work, but maybe I missed something.

Yes, you have reproduced it correctly, the last caused by from the stack trace is the original exception thrown in TransportFactory.

Fixed.

We were wiring in camel subsystem dependencies on the resource adapter deployment which caused some issues for the AMQ resource adapter.

I've added some logic to not do this (for any RA) in future.
